message.entry: Error while executing SSH command: ''{0}''. \nPlease check IP Address, user name and password options.
No network interface cards are detected on this computer.
Choose the network interface the hardware is connected to:
You must choose a network connection.
Wired Ethernet interface "{0}" will be reconfigured\nto communicate with the hardware.

"{0}" must be configured for DHCP to communicate with XXXX.\nIf you do not want to re-configure this network connection, go back to "Configure network"\nscreen and select a different network configuration.
Error while configuring network card for DHCP: {0}
Error while querying a list of network cards: {0}
The network interface "{0}" is not connected.\nCheck your Ethernet connection to the hardware..
Could not detect the hardware on "{0}". Check your Ethernet connection to the hardware.\nFor network trouble-shooting instructions see MathWorks Web Site
Error while adding a route to the hardware: {0}
Error downloading firmware. Wait a couple of minutes and try downloading again.
Writing firmware image to SD card...
Following is a summary of the third-party software information:
Unable to access the memory card. If you removed the memory card from the computer, re-insert it and repeat this operation.
Invalid Board name. Board name must be between 1 and 63 characters long.
There was a problem booting with the SD card inserted. Re-create the SD card and repeat this step.
Cannot find the file containing firmware information:\n"{0}"\nThis file has either been deleted or moved to a different location. Re-install the support package to get the required files.
Corrupted firmware information file: \n"{0}"\nRe-install the support package to get the required files.
Corrupted firmware image. Re-install the support package to get the latest firmware.
"{0}" contains invalid characters. Use only alpha-numeric characters. Please check the {1} provided.
The version of Linux running on your hardware has not been tested with the {0} product. \nUsing an untested version of Linux may produce unexpected results.
Could not find COM port connected to {0} hardware automatically. Please specify the serial port:
Setup for {0} is complete...\n\nMATLAB will use following settings to communicate with {1} hardware:
Wait for {0} hardware to boot up...
Connecting to {0} hardware over serial port...

Could not connect to the hardware over Serial Port.\nCheck that USB cable is plugged into ''USB-to-UART'' port of the hardware and the power switch is turned on.\nIf this error persists, switch off the hardware, wait for 10 seconds, switch on the hardware and then repeat this step.
You must select a serial port connected to your hardware.
The serial port, {0}, is not available. Check that you have selected the correct serial port\nand that no other program is using {1} and repeat this step.
Error writing firmware to the memory card: {0}
Error writing firmware image to the SD card. Firmware write has timed out.\nClick "Back" and try again.
md5sum function requires MATLAB to be started with java. An incorrect checksum of all zeros will be returned.
{0} is not a valid IPv4 address.
The serial console timed out while waiting for a response from the board.\nCheck your serial connection and repeat this operation again.
An error occurred while attempting to send a serial message through the selected serial port {0}.\nCheck that you have selected the correct serial port and repeat this step again.\nDetails: {1}
